You become obsessed with one Survivor.
You lurk in the shadows, eliminating your victims one by one.

You can only be obsessed with one Survivor at a time.

A Hex rooting its power on hope. The false hope of Survivors ignites your hunger.

A hair brooch crusted with dried blood.

A wristwatch with a shattered glass. The name "Rin" is scribbled on the wristband.

A Hex rooting its power on hope. The false hope of Survivors  fills you with excitement and strengthens your totems.

A portable but heavy spool of copper wire.

Your keen senses are sharpened in the dark Realm of The Entity .

Grants 75 % bonus Bloodpoints in the Objectives Category.

There is nothing stopping you.

An old piece of parchment made out of a skin-like material. Is rolled and sealed with an uncoloured leather string. Generators' Auras which you have already encountered are revealed to you for as long as the Map has charges left.

You're able to organise a team to cooperate more efficiently.

Unknown Description.

Your running is light and soft, making your tracks harder to follow.

A fast and thrilling mix tape with energising songs with break-neck beats.

Slightly decreases missed Ambush Attack cool-down.

A toxin applied to the Hatchet's blades. The Amanita mushrooms' toxin numbs the mind.

Does not stack.

Wet, elastic webs that broaden the inter-dimensional tunnels.
Slightly increases the time taken by Survivors to seal a Portal.

A silken bow to tame wild hair.
Moderately increases Yamaoka's Haunting Activation Charge rate.

Night vision lens enabling sharp photos even when shrouded in darkness. Ideal for discreet, impromptu visits late at night.
Considerably reduces the Stalk time when not leaning from cover.

An all time classic.
Moderately increases Reloading Movement speed.

A toxic brew applied to the Hatchets' blades. The thick brew is mainly composed of yew seeds which give it paralytic capabilities.

The Kra-Frabai symbol, representing the Entity watching over us, ominously glows on the head of the Bell.
Unlocks awesome potential in The Wraith's Aura-reading ability.

When cloaked, the Repair Progression of Generators can be determined by the intensity of their Auras.

An anti-haemorrhagic substance that stops the bleeding in a matter of seconds.
Use with Secondary Action.
The affected Survivor will passively gain one Health State 16 seconds after use.
The time required can be modified by Perks and Add-ons that affect Healing speeds.
This effect is cancelled when the affected Survivor changes their Health State  or is picked up by the Killer.
Anti-Haemorrhagic Syringe depletes the Med-Kit on use.

A dark paste made of sharp osseous shavings. The inhaling of its foul fumes sharpens the mind's eye.
Survivors' Auras  are revealed to you for 5 seconds when they vomit.

An organic compound used for anaesthetic purposes.
Slightly increases Intoxicated Effect duration.

Grants 75 % bonus Bloodpoints in the Sacrifice Category.
"Devoutly crafted out of sticks, strings and bones, this wreath calls on the Entity's blessing for more blood."

This intricate mechanical part feels oddly out of place. It is clean and shiny as if straight out of the factory.
Toolbox Repair action is replaced with Install Brand New Part.
Installing the Brand New Part will complete 15 % of a Generator  over 5 seconds.
During the install, you will be faced with 2 difficult Skill Checks .
Hitting each Skill Check will result in 5 % progression for a maximum of 25 % added progression.
Brand New Part is consumed on use.

Tremendously increases the chance to be sent to Gideon Meat Plant when burnt.
"Congratulations. You are still alive. Most people are so ungrateful to be alive. But not you. Not anymore."

A pair of dad glasses that belonged to an overworked salary man.
Survivors' Blood Trails are visible while using Yamaoka's Haunting.

A small, highly-explosive dinner table decoration. Detonates into loud bangs and intense light flashes.
Can be used as a distraction, as a blinding device or to celebrate.
Tremendously increases the chance to be sent to Yamaoka Estate when burnt.

Dark beats, violent shreds and unfathomable vocals from another world fill the mind with a vibrating sixth sense.
While using Feral Frenzy, the Repair Progression of Generators can be determined by the intensity of their Auras.

A crest that denotes its owner as being a part of the Yamaoka family.
While Blood Fury is active, missing a Demon Strike will cause all Survivors within 12 metres to scream and reveal their current location to you.
"Know who you are so you may shield your heart." - Renjiro's Doctrine 11:2

A glass-like king chess piece moulded from The Fog itself. The Entity's trace reverberating within can break the most powerful minds.
The Shock Therapy and Static Blast special abilities cause the Survivor to gain a random Madness  Affliction from the following list:

Iridescent Calm: Survivors hear a constant distant Heartbeat.
Iridescent Discipline: When a Chase begins, Survivors in Madness II perceive the Red Stain and Terror Radius as though The Doctor were right behind them for a duration of 10 seconds.
This effect is constant for Survivors in Madness III.
Iridescent Obedience: Skill Checks  turn counter-clockwise.
Iridescent Order: Broken Pallets may appear to be replaced with Illusionary Pallets that persist until approached.
Iridescent Restraint: Tremendously increased duration for an Illusionary Doctor.
Afflictions of the same type do not stack.
"Gazing in the iridescent glass is plunging oneself into madness."

A glass-like queen chess piece moulded from The Fog itself. It can't be touched without receiving a considerable jolt of electricity.
Any Survivor struck by the Shock Therapy or Static Blast special abilities acquires a lingering Static Charge. The Static Charge remains with the Survivor until discharge.
Multiple Survivors struck by the same Shock Therapy or Static Blast special ability, that are within 4 metres of each other, do not acquire a Static Charge.
Any time a Survivor is within 4 metres of another Survivor carrying a Static Charge, the Survivor receives a shock identical to a Shock Therapy Attack and the Static Charge is discharged immediately.
"Once we have established an effective method of treatment, we can focus on its efficient means of delivery." - Herman Carter

A translucent cylindrical seal moulded from The Fog itself with the effigy of The Plague. Its surface is warm and pulsates with The Entity's power.

Tremendously reduces Corrupt Purge duration.
Moderately decreases Movement speed while holding Corrupt Purge.

Slightly increases Luck .

Moderately increases the Luck  of all Survivors .
"A friable miniature statuette made of black salt representing a woman in a kneeling position offering a gift. Some believe it brings good fortune."

Considerably thickens the Dark Mist.
"The Mist seems to protect us from the beast, but it is a poison, a cancer, filling us with darkness and insanity." - Unknown, Notebook

A modification to the Jigsaw Box: the lubricated parts make the search a more delicate exercise.

A matchbox containing an odd collection of mismatched buttons. Serves as a reminder of a horrible place.

An otherworldly concoction that faintly glows a foreboding light.

Not all games need to have the same rules.

The handguard of an ancestral blade. Crafted for the Yamaoka family.

A grim and incomplete collection of fingers. Fills The Clown with longing and focuses his anaesthetic crafting abilities.

A piece of parchment made out of oddly fresh skin. Blood on its edge has yet to dry. It is rolled and sealed with multiple coloured ropes and cords.
